findings.title: QSP-1 Hard-coded Array Index Allows for Only One Metapool Token
findings.description: In `DepositTemplateMeta.vy` L158, the index for the base pool's LP token is hard-coded in function `remove_liquidity()` as `self.coins[1]`. This can be a problem if the metapool has multiple tokens + base pool LP token.

findings.title: QSP-2 Block Timestamp Manipulation
findings.description: The contract relies on block timestamps which can be manipulated by miners, potentially allowing malicious agents to interfere with the development of Amplification coefficient.

findings.title: QSP-3 Insufficient Input Validation
findings.description: Insufficient input validation allows malicious inputs to affect the contract's behavior.

findings.title: QSP-4 Implicit Assumption that Only One Base Pool Is Allowed per Metapool
findings.description: The code implicitly allows only one base pool per metapool due to the implementation of `__init__()` and `MAX_COINS = N_COINS - 1`.
